result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Trial Order;  signed on 11-04-2022 by Judge J. Arthur Melvin, III

8:31 AM Defendant Walter L Thomas in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Walter L Thomas.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called to schedule Trial in compliance with Speedy Trial Demand. 
Court will issue a trial scheduling order. 
Hearing scheduled for 12/02/22 is removed from the calendar.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on December 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on December 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:38 AM Defendant Walter L Thomas in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Walter L Thomas.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer Carly Rawson, of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Schaller.
Cross examination by attorney Wolff.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witness A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

1:54 PM Defendant Walter L Thomas in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Walter L Thomas.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.
